newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT - Memco estimate raised.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Memco estimate raised.

text.p: Lehman Brothers raised its second-quarter and full-year earnings estimate for Memco Software after the Israeli company reported better-than-expected results in the first quarter.
Memco earned $0.08 a share in the first quarter against $0.01 last year and Lehman's estimate of $0.05.
Lehman raised its estimate for the second quarter to $0.08 a share from $0.06 and for all of 1997 to $0.44 from $0.39.
"We are fine tuning our FY98 estimate down to a conservative $0.85 from our earlier range of $0.85 to $0.90," analyst Michael Stanek wrote in a report.
Lehman reiterated its 1-Buy rating for the company. The shares are trading at $12-1/2.
